members.name: getName
members.comment: Fetches the name of the set of key-bindings.

members.name: getDefaultAction
members.comment: Fetches the default action to fire if a key is typed (i.e. a KEY_TYPED KeyEvent is received) and there is no binding for it. Typically this would be some action that inserts text so that the keymap doesn't require an action for each possible key.

members.name: setDefaultAction
members.comment: Set the default action to fire if a key is typed.

members.name: getAction
members.comment: Fetches the action appropriate for the given symbolic event sequence. This is used by JTextController to determine how to interpret key sequences. If the binding is not resolved locally, an attempt is made to resolve through the parent keymap, if one is set.

return: the action associated with the key sequence if one is defined, otherwise null

members.name: getBoundKeyStrokes
members.comment: Fetches all of the keystrokes in this map that are bound to some action.

members.name: getBoundActions
members.comment: Fetches all of the actions defined in this keymap.

members.name: getKeyStrokesForAction
members.comment: Fetches the keystrokes that will result in the given action.

members.name: isLocallyDefined
members.comment: Determines if the given key sequence is locally defined.

return: true if the key sequence is locally defined else false

members.name: addActionForKeyStroke
members.comment: Adds a binding to the keymap.

members.name: removeKeyStrokeBinding
members.comment: Removes a binding from the keymap.

members.name: removeBindings
members.comment: Removes all bindings from the keymap.

members.name: getResolveParent
members.comment: Fetches the parent keymap used to resolve key-bindings.

members.name: setResolveParent
members.comment: Sets the parent keymap, which will be used to resolve key-bindings. The behavior is unspecified if a Keymap has itself as one of its resolve parents.

name: javax.swing.text.Keymap
comment: A collection of bindings of KeyStrokes to actions. The bindings are basically name-value pairs that potentially resolve in a hierarchy.
